meanings.definition: To remove the sacred or religious character from something.
meanings.sent1: The new museum exhibit desacralizes the ancient artifacts by displaying them without any reverence.
meanings.sent2: The act of desacralizing the temple turned it into a regular meeting place for the community.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his messy room desacralizes the concept of cleanliness.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti artist desacralizes the blank walls by adding colorful and bold designs.
meanings.sent5: The modern art movement aims to desacralize traditional artistic norms and challenge perceptions.

meanings.definition: To make something no longer considered holy or sacred.
meanings.sent1: The construction of the new road desacralizes the ancient burial ground that was once revered.
meanings.sent2: The decision to desacralize the old church upset many parishioners who valued its historical significance.
meanings.sent3: The chef's unconventional recipe desacralizes the traditional dish by adding unexpected ingredients.
meanings.sent4: The demolition of the historic building desacralizes the memories associated with it.
meanings.sent5: The modern society often desacralizes ancient traditions in favor of new customs and beliefs.
